Sentence: He (Prince) is called to intervene in a marital dispute between his (Prince) close friends, Arnold and Rachel Baffin
During the fight, Rachel Baffin hits her (Baffin) head on the fireplace poker, but is not dead, as Arnold initially fears
While all of this is happening, Arnold Baffin becomes interested in having an affair with Christian and Rachel Baffin becomes interested in sleeping with Bradley
Despite Rachel and Arnold's anger, Bradley refuses to see that his (Bradley) love is inappropriate

Rachel tells Bradley that Julian left him (Bradley) freely because she (Rachel) learned of Bradley's recent sexual encounter with Rachel -LRB-Rachel had described the encounter in a letter that Arnold delivered-RRB-
Bradley is so angry at Rachel's interference that he (Bradley) spitefully shows her (Rachel) a letter that Arnold wrote describing Arnold's love for Christian
After arriving at the Baffins' house, Bradley finds Arnold dead, having been hit with the same fire poker that once hit Rachel
